intro: Origanum albiflorum, commonly known as whiteflower oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its essential oils, which contain compounds like carvacrol and thymol, contribute to its strong scent and medicinal properties. It is often used in culinary applications and traditional herbal remedies.
